intro: Stemodia tephropelina, commonly known as the red-stemmed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its stems are reddish in color, which gives it its common name, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The leaves are usually narrow and hairy, contributing to its drought-resistant nature.
